column1: Low Estrogen After Operation to Remove Ovaries
column2: Lolla, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I've only been on this med for 2 weeks and will remain on it for 1 month just to be fair and allow it to work its way through my system. Side effects, yes, one: body aches. I'm a runner and hiker and this tiny pill is proving to be a pill. Because I know my estrogen level is low, I will give it a fair shot. I just don't like when anything interferes with my workout regiment.

column1: Low Estrogen After Operation to Remove Ovaries
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: The medication was very effective but after six months of use, I found a small lump which begin to form in my right breast.  I cannot say that the medication caused this but it scared me enough to discontinue using it. I had a biopsy and the lump was not cancerous.

column1: Low Estrogen After Operation to Remove Ovaries
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: My Doctor put me on Estrace after i had a full hysterectomy. It seems to be working for me I have on hot flashes and the only mood swing is I want to cry every morning. I've only been on this medication for 2 1/2 weeks so I hope the crying will soon stop and the medication continue to work.

column1: Low Estrogen After Operation to Remove Ovaries
column2: Susan, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I had my surgery many years ago, I was put on Premarin almost immediately and had no problem taking it. After being on it for so many years, the Dr. then decided to put me in Estrace, it does take the hot flashes and mood swings away, but the weight gain, headaches, body aches are becoming unbearable. Have an appointment with the Dr. to change it. I have headaches that are debilitating and I don't like it!

column1: Low Estrogen After Operation to Remove Ovaries

column9: I've been taking this medication for 10 years with no problems.  It has worked well for me.

column1: Vaginal Inflammation due to Loss of Hormone Stimulation
column2: cosmokitten, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: It was very effective in relieving my vaginal dryness but I had to stop using it because of the side effects. I began experiencing vision problems and became intolerant of my contact lenses. It took a lot of research to figure out that my eye problems were caused by the Estrace. I have stopped using it and my eyes are back to normal.

column1: &quot;Change of Life&quot; Signs
column2: Cindi, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am 45 and had an eblation at age 40 which terminated menstruation. Started having hot flashes, dizzyness, feeling frail six months ago. Mentioned these symptoms to my doctor and he started me on this and it is like a miracle. I feel GOOD. The only drawback is the pill looks almost exactly like xanax, i really have to check and double check that i am taking the correct pill.

column1: &quot;Change of Life&quot; Signs
column2: NYCKL64, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: My Dr. put me on 2mg of this along with 40mg prozac, after day 3 i noticed what felt like sand on my torso..and it itched, couple of days later almost looked like a flea bite..i have dogs but have never had a flea bite itch, i wonder if this could be one of the side effects..I'LL TAKE THE ITCHING which isn' that bad over the MOOD SWINGS FROM 0-90 AND HOT FLASHES THAT EVEN SURPRISED MY HUSBAND, ANY DAY...ITCH AWAY...OTHER THAN THAT, THEY ARE DOING WONDERS FOR ME...WOOHOO!!!

column1: Other

column9: My fertility doctor has put me on this medicine to help assist in me sustaining a pregnancy. I am not pregnant yet but plan to be hopefully soon. this medicine makes me very tired!!

column1: Low Estrogen After Operation to Remove Ovaries
column2: mhruza, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had a partial hysterectomy when i was 22 years of age. I am now 35 and I just had to have an oopherectomy (removing both ovaries due to cysts on my ovaries and 1 was in early stages of cancer. Since i've had them removed i was started on Estrace "Estradiol" right away. when i first started with the pill everything went really well. mood swings are much better. I still have worries about the bone loss i've already had. for the past 5 years my estragen wasn't right. I am dealing with degeratative disc dease. and arthritis in my lower back.

column1: Low Estrogen After Operation to Remove Ovaries
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I had a hysterectomy due to fibroids and SEVERE mood swings.  PMDD?!?! I put that name to shame.  After my surgery and being put on Estrace my life has changed for the better.  I'm no longer hormonal, angry, depressed, suicidal.  AND I have no side affects.  Not one!!  This was the best thing that could have happened to me.

column1: Low Estrogen After Operation to Remove Ovaries
column2: phylis, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: After more than a year, I have become very sun-sensitive, have severe swelling in hands, feet, and lower legs, rash, dizziness, and no sexual interest.

column1: &quot;Change of Life&quot; Signs
column2: roselyn, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: At age 50 I had a radical hysterectomy and began estrogen replacement therapy.  Seven years later I had DCIS (non-invasive breast cancer surgery) and was taken off my estrogen for seven months.  I elected to start it again and had been fine.  Last year I stopped, thinking at age 67 I was past needing estrogen.  WRONG!!  Insomnia, warm flashes, mood swings all came back.  Just started back again on 1mg 3 times per week and looking forward to feeling better again soon. I'd rather live 10 more years feeling good than 20 more years feeling like I've felt for the past few months.  I've been cancer free for 10 years and have yearly mammograms.  My doctors say the benefits outweight the risks.

column1: Post-Menopausal Osteoporosis Prevention
column2: shocked, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had a hysterectomy in Janaury 2009 in order to take estrogen to stop my bone loss. It was the only safe way to take this medication without the risk of cancer, as it runs very highly in my family. I also have had severe reactions to 4 osteoporosis medications, and my doctor and I have decided that I should not take any more of these medications. They have caused lasting medical problems for me. So far I am very satisfied with my estrogen treatment.

column1: Vaginal Inflammation due to Loss of Hormone Stimulation
column2: Sunny, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Currently taking Depo (Verva) for birth control the first time. no problems after 8yrs i decided to choose this method again. Not the same results. I was constantly spotting no a good thing in a new relationship!  My doctor suggest I take it for seven days to stop the spotting. So far so good and i must admit that my interest to "participate" in bed was restored as well.  Hope you find this helpful.

column1: Low Estrogen After Operation to Remove Ovaries

column9: After my hysterectomy, I tried two different patches.  I still had symptoms, the estrogen delivery was not even. After being on the estrace pills, I feel like a new woman, both mentally and phyically.  It alleviated all of my symptoms.
